FuncDef:
The timer hold command sets a polling interval.
The undo timer hold command restores the default setting.
By default, the polling interval of the link layer protocol is 10 seconds on an interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a polling interval.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 32767, in seconds. The value 0 indicates the link detection is disabled.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The polling intervals set at both ends of a link must be the same. If the polling interval is set to 0 at both ends, the link detection is disabled.
If one end of a link does not receive any Keepalive packets from the other end within five polling intervals, the local end considers that the other end is faulty and sets the local interface to Down.
If a network experiences a heavy delay or severe congestion, you can prolong the polling interval to reduce the possibility of network flapping.
A polling interval cannot be set on GE or Ethernet interfaces.
